titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I attended the Celebration in Henry VII's Chapel. The Bishop of London officiated in the absence of the Archbishop, who was attending a Committee for the Reconstruction of the House of Lords. Then I sate in the Upper House of Convocation until lunch time.
The Bishops of London & Winchester made civil speeches about me, but they had a hollow sound, & rather increased than mitigated my resentment
I lunched with Sir John & Lady Struthers. Sir William Macormack [McCormick] & M

Munro, the Secretary for Scotland, were also present, & we had much interesting conversation. We called on Lady Ilbert and had tea with her. Then we walked back to Lambeth, where I wrote a number of letters. The Bishops of Peterborough & S
Edmundsbury & Ipswich came to dinner: also M
Aitken the Vicar of Lambeth, the Prolocutor, & the Archdeacon of Norfolk (?) [sic]
